comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: So to summarize this PR: it fixes Item.Target for symbolic links to be resolved via realpath if the target exists, and otherwise uses readlink to get the (non-existent but valid) target. This way PowerShell behaves appropriately (as it assumes all symlinks are absolute, as on Windows).

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: I'm going to merge, but need to fixup more native code directory exists.

title: Fixing symlink to use absolute paths instead of relative
